title: Bug 118780 - Old column names are displayed in expression builder instead of the newly set aliases
description: When setting aliases for columns in a dataset, the expression builder still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset.
OB: After setting aliases for columns in the dataset, the expression builder displays the old column names instead of the newly set aliases when selecting the dataset.
EB: After setting aliases for columns in the dataset, the expression builder should display the newly set aliases instead of the old column names when selecting the dataset.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new datasource and dataset.
2. Set an alias for the first column in the dataset, e.g., 'column1'.
3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset.
4. Open the expression builder.
5. Select the dataset in the expression builder.

Expected behavior:
The expression builder should display the newly set alias ('column1') for the first column in the dataset instead of the old column name.

Observed behavior:
The expression builder displays the old column name instead of the newly set alias when selecting the dataset.
